dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: 1.5 million monthly users for their Super App, but this Kazpost.kz e-commerce platform sounds like a total mess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: one point five million monthly users for their Super App, but this the website e-commerce platform sounds like a total mess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO and co-founder of Kaspi.kz, commented: Our Kaspi.kz Super App has now reached 8.5 million monthly users, further cementing its market leading position.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Mikhail Lomtadze himself admitted they've cut delivery to just 24 cities and slashed their product range to 50,000 items. That's a huge pullback.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Mikhail Lomtadze himself admitted they've cut delivery to just twenty four cities and slashed their product range to fifty thousand items. That's a huge pullback.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We have expanded delivery to 54 cities and increased the range of products to almost 400,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And he's thanking dissatisfied clients for staying away? That's uh, not the usual corporate messaging.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he's thanking dissatisfied clients for staying away? That's uh, not the usual corporate messaging.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thank you to each of our valued clients and partners for being with us! - added Mikhail Lomtadze.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It's almost like a bizarrely honest admission. He says they're hindering retailers, limiting sales, even contributing to job losses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It's almost like a bizarrely honest admission. He says they're hindering retailers, limiting sales, even contributing to job losses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are helping our retailers increase their sales, grow their business and retain jobs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But wait, they still have some big names, right? Like Puma, Zara, Bershka—those aren't exactly unknown brands.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But wait, they still have some big names, right? Like Puma, Zara, Bershka-those aren't exactly unknown brands.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Such well-known international brands as Adidas, O'STIN, UGG, New balance, SPORTMASTER, KOTON, ALDO, SKECHERS, Ecco, DECATHLON, DeFacto, Marks & Spencer, Nike, Reebok and many others sell through Kaspi.kz e-Commerce platform.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, but then he lists partners like Qazaq Republic, which is discontinued, and BALAUSA Jewellery, which went bankrupt. Not the strongest lineup.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but then he lists partners like Qazaq Republic, which is discontinued, and B A L A U S A Jewellery, which went bankrupt. Not the strongest lineup.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And that ranking they're in—the BOTTOM KZ Retail E-Commerce list—compiled by Forbes Kazakhstan with what he calls a rogue accounting firm? That's… quite a claim.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that ranking they're in-the B O T T O M K Z Retail E-Commerce list-compiled by Forbes Kazakhstan with what he calls a rogue accounting firm? That's... quite a claim.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce ranking is compiled annually by Forbes Kazakhstan together with the international consulting company Baker Tilly Kazakhstan and the Digital Association of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It does sound like he's dismissing the ranking, but the numbers themselves are pretty damning. Purchases up 5% in value but down 10% in volume? That's weird.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It does sound like he's dismissing the ranking, but the numbers themselves are pretty damning. Purchases up five percent in value but down ten percent in volume? That's weird.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The amount of purchases grew 125%, the number of purchases by 150% compared to last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Almost 50 billion tenge from a million purchases though—that's still a lot of money moving through a "marginal" platform.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Almost fifty billion tenge from a million purchases though-that's still a lot of money moving through a marginal platform.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For the first eight months of this year, our users made 2.6 million online purchases for almost 200 billion tenge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Marginal partner for most companies, he said. In the context of pandemic retail expansion, that's quite an admission of failure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Marginal partner for most companies, he said. In the context of pandemic retail expansion, that's quite an admission of failure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the context of retail restrictions related to the coronavirus pandemic, our e-Commerce platform is an essential partner for many companies in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So why even keep it running if it's so poorly integrated and they're cutting features to save costs?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So why even keep it running if it's so poorly integrated and they're cutting features to save costs?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our e-Commerce platform, the largest e-commerce business in the country, is seamlessly integrated into our app and our team continues to work tirelessly to improve user experience.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Maybe the Super App user base is the only thing propping it up. But at this rate, it sounds unsustainable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Maybe the Super App user base is the only thing propping it up. But at this rate, it sounds unsustainable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I can't see how this doesn't end badly for them and their remaining partners.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I can't see how this doesn't end badly for them and their remaining partners.

artist_script:
HostA: 1.5 million monthly users for their Super App, but this Kazpost.kz e-commerce platform sounds like a total mess.
HostB: Yeah, Mikhail Lomtadze himself admitted they've cut delivery to just 24 cities and slashed their product range to 50,000 items. That's a huge pullback.
HostA: And he's thanking dissatisfied clients for staying away? That's uh, not the usual corporate messaging.
HostB: Right? It's almost like a bizarrely honest admission. He says they're hindering retailers, limiting sales, even contributing to job losses.
HostA: But wait, they still have some big names, right? Like Puma, Zara, Bershka—those aren't exactly unknown brands.
HostB: True, but then he lists partners like Qazaq Republic, which is discontinued, and BALAUSA Jewellery, which went bankrupt. Not the strongest lineup.
HostA: And that ranking they're in—the BOTTOM KZ Retail E-Commerce list—compiled by Forbes Kazakhstan with what he calls a rogue accounting firm? That’s… quite a claim.
HostB: It does sound like he's dismissing the ranking, but the numbers themselves are pretty damning. Purchases up 5% in value but down 10% in volume? That’s weird.
HostA: Almost 50 billion tenge from a million purchases though—that’s still a lot of money moving through a "marginal" platform.
HostB: Marginal partner for most companies, he said. In the context of pandemic retail expansion, that’s quite an admission of failure.
HostA: So why even keep it running if it's so poorly integrated and they're cutting features to save costs?
HostB: Maybe the Super App user base is the only thing propping it up. But at this rate, it sounds unsustainable.
HostA: Yeah, I can’t see how this doesn’t end badly for them and their remaining partners.
